alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Harrison; Mills; Montgomery; Page; Pottawattamie; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 10 at 10:19AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...HAZARDOUS WINTER WEATHER THREATS CONTINUE... .A quick burst of snow is forecast across the area this afternoon and evening with accumulations expected to remain below 1 inch. Greater accumulations are expected over the second half of Thursday through Friday afternoon. Dangerously cold wind chills are expected to accompany the system and linger into next week. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 7 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Iowa and southeast Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday afternoon through Friday afternoon. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Fremont; Harrison; Mills; Montgomery; Page; Pottawattamie; Shelby
